name: Stockholm Syndrome
wikiSummary: Stockholm syndrome is a real, psychological effect sometimes seen in an abducted hostage, in which the hostage shows signs of loyalty to the hostage-taker, regardless of the danger or in which they have been placed.  This song was made available as downloadable content for Guitar Hero 3.  Mike Portnoy of Dream Theater covered the intro on his drumming focused ‘‘In Constant Motion‘‘ DVD  When the chorus is played backwards, the message " You can't see me, you sneak off. I lost your love. Please ... save me" can be heard.
wikiText:
Stockholm syndrome is a real, psychological effect sometimes seen in an abducted hostage, in which the hostage shows signs of loyalty to the hostage-taker, regardless of the danger or in which they have been placed.
 
 This song was made available as downloadable content for Guitar Hero 3.
 
 Mike Portnoy of Dream Theater covered the intro on his drumming focused ‘‘In Constant Motion‘‘ DVD
 
 When the chorus is played backwards, the message " You can't see me, you sneak off. I lost your love. Please ... save me" can be heard.
 
 According to Matthew Bellamy, the riff in the song is inspired by System of a Down.
